metadata.title: Overview

content:
### 游늷 What is buy driven forecast?

The *Buy Driven Forecast* module produces season-level demand forecasts for each product-store pair, based on the buy quantities computed earlier.
These forecasts help retailers:

- Plan inventory and replenishment
- Measure the efficiency of their purchasing decisions
- Build downstream forecasting or planning models

The module uses buy quantity data and historical sales patterns, applying a scaling process controlled by configurable parameters.

---

---

#### Input Parameters

| Parameter | Description |
| --- | --- |
| run_date | Date on which the module is executed |
| forecast_mode | Mode of operation: create or append |
| scaling_factor | Default scaling multiplier applied to distribute season-level buys over weeks (default: 1) |
| io_control_mode | Duplicate output control strictness |

---

### 救 Key Assumptions

- buy_quantity data is accurate and updated before forecast runs.
- active_season_pairs correctly maps each product-store to a single active season.
- product_store_seasonality reflects realistic historical sales distribution over weeks.
- Season definitions in the season table do not overlap for the same product.

---

### 游늳 Flow Overview

#### Common Steps

metadata.title: 游닍 Buy Driven Forecast Implementation / ASO

content:
n the season table do not overlap for the same product.

---

### 游늳 Flow Overview

#### Common Steps

1. Load buy quantities, active season pairs, and seasonality indices.
2. Map product-store-season to supplying warehouse(s).
3. Scale and distribute buy quantities over season weeks.
4. Aggregate and save the final forecasts.

---

### 丘뙖잺 Detailed Steps

#### 1勇 Process Buy Quantities

- Filter buy_quantity by active seasons.
- Join with product_destination_source_relation to identify supplying warehouses for each product-store pair.

#### 2勇 Calculate Weekly Forecast

- Use product_store_seasonality to get weekly distribution percentages.
- Multiply buy quantity 칑 weekly percentage 칑 scaling_factor.
- Ensure the sum of weekly forecasts 곋 total buy quantity 칑 scaling_factor.

#### 3勇 Handle Modes

- Create: Rebuild forecasts for all seasons.
- Append: Only forecast for new product-store-season triplets; keep existing forecasts for others.

---

### 游늵 Output

metadata.title: 游닍 Buy Driven Forecast Implementation / ASO

content:
recast for new product-store-season triplets; keep existing forecasts for others.

---

### 游늵 Output

| Output Table | Description |
| --- | --- |
| buy_driven_forecast | Weekly forecast quantities by product, store, season, and week number |

- Stored under: {noob_home}/buy-driven-forecast
- Includes metadata: run date, mode, and parameters used.

---

## Product Store Seasonality Table creation

`product_store_seasonality`

This data is needed in order to run the buy driven forecast module since the data maps the seasons with products and stores and will be used as a scope for our forecast module.

- How alo did it? Alo team has managed to generate this data with the help of 3 tables from feed:season_skulog maps the products with seasonsseason_master for joining the season start & end datesstore to be used to map the stores with the dataframe

metadata.title: 游닍 Buy Driven Forecast Implementation / ASO

content:
master for joining the season start & end datesstore to be used to map the stores with the dataframe

In order to publish this data we need a product-season mapping, we will be generating this mapping with the use of the extended product feed table, we will be using this table to calculate the

metadata.title: 游닍 Buy Driven Forecast Implementation / ASO

content:
apping with the use of the extended product feed table, we will be using this table to calculate the

- How ASO did it? ASO does not have season_skulog in it뗩 feed, so we need to start with a product-season mapping first. This will be done by extracting the product-season pairs from past data. From that point onwards, we will be needing to update this data on a regular basis. In order to do this, we will be using a preetl that extracts product and season codes from a table called extended_products under cumulative_feed this table will be named cumulative_product_seasonalityAfter we have created this data, we will be needing 3 tablescumulative_product_seasonality maps the products with seasonscumulative_season for joining the season start & end datescumulative_extended_storeto be used to map the stores with the dataframe

---

## 游빑 Buy Quantity

We will be using the default BuyQuantityCalculator module of noob.

### BuyQuantityCalculator Module:

metadata.title: 游닍 Buy Driven Forecast Implementation / ASO

content:
e will be using the default BuyQuantityCalculator module of noob.

### BuyQuantityCalculator Module:

Calculates buy quantities for each `product-warehouse-season` by combining:

1. Ready-to-Replenishment = warehouse inventory + open purchase orders
2. Quantities Pushed to Stores = goods in transit + store orders + store inventory + sales
3. Final Buy Quantity = sum of the above, with outlier filtering via percentile

Supports two modes:

- create: Full recalculation from scratch
- append: Adds new data, replaces overlapping rows

### Calculation Logic

- Outputs are aggregated by product_id, warehouse_id, and season_id
- Uses 95th percentile (default) per group to reduce outliers (default_percentile_value is configurable)

### 游닌 Inputs

Tables:

metadata.title: 游닍 Buy Driven Forecast Implementation / ASO

content:
ault) per group to reduce outliers (default_percentile_value is configurable)

### 游닌 Inputs

Tables:

| Table | Required? | ASO Specific |
| --- | --- | --- |
| inventory_warehouse | 九 | 九 |
| purchase_order | 仇 | 九 |
| open_orders | 仇 | 九 |
| goods_in_transit | 仇 | 九 |
| daily data | 九 | 九 |
| active_seasons | 九 | 仇 |
| product_season_lookup_range | 九 | 仇 |
| product_destination_source_relation | 九 | 九 |

Parameters:

- default_percentile_value (default = 0.95)
- store_warehouse_relations_table_name
- use_pdsr_as_store_warehouse
- io_control_mode
- season_date_shift (e.g., 14 days)

### Output

A DataFrame with:

- warehouse_id, product_id, season_id  and buy_quantity

Saved to:
`{noob_home}/buy-quantity`

### Notes

- Optional tables (purchase_order, open_orders, goods_in_transit) are not required
- Designed for flexibility and duplicate-safe appends
- Season logic handled via active_seasons and product_season_lookup_range

---

## 游듹勇 Season Lookup Generator

metadata.title: 游닍 Buy Driven Forecast Implementation / ASO

content:
logic handled via active_seasons and product_season_lookup_range

---

## 游듹勇 Season Lookup Generator

Generates a clean, conflict-free season lookup table from `product_store_seasonality` and `season` master data.
It resolves issues like overlapping seasons or inconsistent season assignments across hierarchy levels.

### Key Features:

- Supports two conflict resolution strategies:Use provided season priority listDefault to lowest season_id
- Outputs:Expanded format: exploded by dateRange format: compact per pair-season rangeOption to save one or both formats

Useful for downstream modules that require reliable, non-overlapping season mappings.
See unit tests or main method docstrings for implementation details.

metadata.title: 游닍 Buy Driven Forecast Implementation / ASO
